description: The Los Angeles County District Attorney said that although the brothers had committed a crime, the circumstance surrounding the murders should be taken into account.
title: DA recommends resentencing of Menendez brothers for 1989 slaying of their parents

description: Inside the Los Angeles Times, MSNBC, and the Washington Post, journalists question whether news executives are making editorial decisions with an eye to appeasing former President Donald Trump.
title: Did the 'L.A. Times' and other news outlets pull punches to appease Trump?

description: Biden’s message, to come during a trip to Arizona, would be the first public apology from a sitting U.S. president in response to a federal policy that wreaked havoc on tribal communities.
title: Biden to issue landmark apology over Native American boarding schools

description: How to keep polling places safe is becoming part of regular police training in Georgia.
title: Police and poll workers train for possible election threats

description: The number of people that have been diagnosed with a pneumonia-causing bacteria has increased over the past six months. Older people are at higher risk of pneumococcal diseases like pneumonia and menningitis.
title: The CDC now recommends that people 50 and older get vaccinated against pneumonia

description: Florida’s Attorney General is asking a federal judge to allow the state to prosecute Ryan Routh, the man accused of attempting to assassinate former President Donald Trump at his golf club.
title: Florida fighting with the U.S. Justice Department over prosecuting Ryan Routh

description: What’s a traveler with a carry-on bag to do as they watch scores of people file onto a plane with limited overhead bin space? Wait their turn, American Airlines says.
title: 'Gate lice' begone? Airline seeks to enforce order in boarding process

description: So far, South Korea has helped Ukraine by providing arms to the U.S. and other countries. But South Korea's government said that could change with North Korean troops deploying for Russia.
title: South Korea warns it may send Ukraine weapons after North Korea sent troops to Russia

description: Vice President Harris will have a special guest at her rally in Houston on Friday: Beyonce.
title: BeyHive meets KHive: Beyonce set to perform at Houston rally for Harris

description: Here are the honorable mentions from the 2024 Student Podcast Challenge. Congratulations!
title: 2024 Student Podcast Challenge Honorable Mentions

description: Harris initially generated renewed enthusiasm as a presidential candidate, but that may be leveling off among young voters. And, a rural family is redefining what it means to be conservative.
title: Young voters’ elation for Harris may be plateauing. And, redefining 'conservative'

description: Pat Rush and her family left Arkansas in the wake of one of the largest migrations in U.S. history, in the hope of making a better life for themselves out west.
title: The story of the American migrant — from Dust Bowl to a new life

description: As the female-dominated sport gets more acrobatic, girls are racking up more concussions and other injuries. A new pediatricians' report calls for change.
title: Youth cheerleading is getting more athletic — and riskier

description: The statement from Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton "corrects falsehoods" from critics who say death row inmate Robert Roberson was unjustifiably convicted in the death of his toddler child.
title: Texas attorney general's statement rejects supporters of death row inmate's appeal

description: Conservative influencer Charlie Kirk has focused his political organization on winning Trump another turn. But many longtime Republicans are concerned about the group's effectiveness.
title: Beyond campuses and churches, can Charlie Kirk turn out votes for Trump?

description: On a visit to a sprawling history-rich farmer's market and a family farm, NPR asks people with agricultural and rural interests, what's on your mind as you cast your vote?
title: A Pennsylvania farming family struggles to find their place in Trump's GOP

description: Hawkins became a darling of the track and field world when she took up running at 100 years old. She died in Baton Rouge, La., this week.
title: Senior sprinter Julia 'Hurricane' Hawkins dies at 108

description: Many middle-income families are frustrated by the cost of higher education, feeling they earn too much for financial aid, but not enough to pay for it themselves.
title: Some colleges are targeting financial aid to middle-class families

description: Arizona has seen rising support for abortion rights among Latinos. The reasons are varied and complicated.
title: Want to understand the dramatic shift in Latino views on abortion? Go to Arizona

description: "Have you ever tried to overthrow the U.S. government?" Marine Sgt. Joshua Abate was in the middle of a routine polygraph test to receive top-secret clearance when he made an extraordinary admission: He had followed the crowd that broke into the U.S. Capitol on January 6, 2021. This admission leads to a different kind of January 6 story. Abate says he's not an insurrectionist. So why did it take him so long to talk openly about that day? To listen to this series sponsor-free and support NPR, sign up for Embedded+ in Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.
title: A Good Guy: 279 Hours

description: The editorials editor of the LA Times resigned after the newspaper’s owner blocked the editorial board’s plans to endorse Vice President Harris for president, a journalism trade publication reported.
title: 'Los Angeles Times' editor resigns after newspaper withholds presidential endorsement

description: The deployment raises the potential for the North Koreans to join Russian forces in Ukraine and suggests expanded military ties between the two nations as Moscow seeks weapons and troops.
title: U.S. says North Korea has sent troops to Russia for training

description: The estimate includes damages and potential investments to prevent similar destruction in future storms.
title: North Carolina government calculates Hurricane Helene damages, needs at least $53B
